divs: sighting detailstaking my dog outside. my roommate was outside smoking and pointed it out to me and asked me what i thought it was. at first i thought it was a bunch of balloons twirling in the wind or perhaps the goodyear blimp. it moved slowly from the south to the north. it glowed very dimly orange. as it came closer we could tell it mas much further up in the sky than previously thought. it appeared to be 4 globes circling around each other. after crossing the sky it started to rise and just kept rising. we watched until it became as faint as a star and then disappeared. there was no sound. i tried to get it on video camera but the batteries were dead. i have always been a skeptic and know i wasn't dreaming... i certainly hadnt been drinking, plus i wasnt the first to see it. i am sure there is a logical explanation. perhaps someone else saw the same thing. i still don't know what to think. i have a rocket scientist friend from jpl \ nasa . she is going to look into it some more.
trends: There have been 404 other sightings in Los Angeles
There were no other sightings in Los Angeles on or around March 16th 2006
Summary: Slow moving rotating dim glowing orbs
